title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3ยง 2.7 - Briefs and argument after taking evidence
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3ยง 2.7 - Briefs and argument after taking evidence

State Regulations

After the evidence has been taken, whether before the Banking

Board itself or a hearing officer, and within such time as may be fixed by the

Banking Board or the hearing officer as the case may be, the respondent and the
superintendent shall be afforded an opportunity to file briefs and proposed
findings with, and shall be allowed oral argument before, the Banking Board or
the hearing officer as the case may be. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3ยง
2.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
